stepAnswer: $$3x-\frac{x^3}{12}+\frac{x^2}{2}$$ as the limits go from $$x=-2$$ to $$x=6$$
stepTitle: If R is the region bounded above by the graph of the function $$f(x)=9-{\left(\frac{x}{2}\right)}^2$$ and below by the graph of the function $$g(x)=6-x$$, fin the area of region R.
